p: The p-factor is the percentage of observed data enveloped by the modelling result, also known as the 95 percent prediction uncertainty (95PPU) while the r-factor is the relative thickness of the 95PPU band (see Abbaspour et al., 2004, and Schuol et al., 2008, for details). Depending on the quality of measured data the p-factor should range around 0.60 while the r-factor should be <1.3. Once p-factor and r-factor are satisfactory model performance can be statistically evaluated using R 2, NSE, bR 2, and RSR.
